fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks.AcceleratedClock

  • Packages that use AcceleratedClock 
    Package Description
    fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks
    Accelerated clocks for time-triggered test scenarios in BCM4Java.

    • Uses of AcceleratedClock in fr.sorbonne_u.utils.aclocks

      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<AcceleratedClock>> ClocksServer.clocks
      map that contains the clocks previously created; must be synchronised.

      AcceleratedClock ClocksServerInboundPort.createClock(java.lang.String clockURI, long unixEpochStartTimeInNanos, java.time.Instant startInstant, double accelerationFactor)
      the call is handled in a synchronous way, hence when the caller receives the result, the clock is immediately accessible to other components.
      AcceleratedClock ClocksServer.getClock(java.lang.String clockURI)
      return the clock associated with clockURI of null if none; the result will be serialised and deserialised if the call is made among distributed components, hence creating a copy of the clock local to the receiver process using the physical clock of the receiver host as time base for evolution; the call will block and wait if the clock of the given URI has not been created yet.
      AcceleratedClock ClocksServerOutboundPort.getClock(java.lang.String clockURI) 
      AcceleratedClock ClocksServerConnector.getClock(java.lang.String clockURI) 
      AcceleratedClock ClocksServerCI.getClock(java.lang.String clockURI)
      return the clock associated with clockURI of null if none.
      AcceleratedClock ClocksServerInboundPort.getClock(java.lang.String clockURI)
